snippet: Germany's central bank roughly doubled the money it set aside to cover risks from the sovereign debt crisis, to €7.7 billion.
abstract: Germany's central bank, Bundesbank, reports that its profit plunged in 2011, as it set aside money to cover risks from the sovereign debt crisis; profit in 2011 fell 71 percent, to 642 million euros, or $841.8 million, from 2.2 billion euros in 2010.
lead_paragraph: Germany's central bank roughly doubled the money it set aside to cover risks from the sovereign debt crisis, to €7.7 billion.

headline.main: Debt Crisis Provisions Hurt Bundesbank Profit
headline.print_headline: Debt Crisis Provisions Hurt Bundesbank Profit
